Parakeets

Indian Ringneck Parakeet

An elegant, medium-sized parrot with a long tail. They are typically bright green, but color mutations include blue, yellow, and white. Males are distinguished by a black and rose-colored ring around their neck.

Origin
Asiatic (India)
Size
16 inches (40.5 cm). Weight: 110-140g (3.9-4.9 oz)
Weight
125g avg.
Noise Level
Moderate to Loud. They have a loud, high-pitched, piercing call that they are not afraid to use, especially if they are seeking attention.

Looking for a Indian Ringneck Parakeet?

See Available Indian Ringneck Parakeet Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 7/10
Social Needs 7/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Extremely intelligent and can be independent. They can make wonderful, affectionate pets if socialized from a young age, but can also go through a bluffing stage during adolescence.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Exceptional talkers. They are known for their incredibly clear, human-like voices and can develop an extensive vocabulary of words and phrases.

Dietary Needs

A pelleted diet supplemented with a wide array of fresh fruits, vegetables, and greens. They are known for enjoying a varied diet.

Health & Lifespan

Relatively healthy and can live 25-30 years. Susceptible to polyomavirus, psittacosis, and respiratory infections. Excellent fliers even with clipped wings.

Housing Requirements

Can be suitable for apartment living if the owner is prepared for their potential noise. They need a tall cage to accommodate their long tail, minimum 24"W x 24"D x 36"H.

Common Questions About Indian Ringneck Parakeet

What is the lifespan of a Indian Ringneck Parakeet?

The Indian Ringneck Parakeet typically lives for 25-30 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Indian Ringneck Parakeet good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'intermediate' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Indian Ringneck Parakeet come from?

The Indian Ringneck Parakeet is native to Asiatic (India).

More Parakeets

Bourke's Parakeet

Very Quiet. They have a soft, melodious twittering call, making them one of the best choices for those who want a quiet bird.

Budgerigar (Budgie)

Quiet. Their chatter is generally pleasant and not disruptive, making them ideal for almost any living situation.

Cockatiel

Moderate. They whistle, chirp, and can be vocal especially at dawn and dusk. Not as loud as larger parrots but can be persistent.
